content.description:
From the angled off colored granite crimps, work your way up the massive Buda Belly and more great, sharp crimps to a huge overhand side pull. After lifting up off of it to a door knob jug, bring high feet for an easy top out.

Note: This Boulder is usually in direct sunlight, so it's recommended to climb in the cool hours of the day.
content.protection: The landing is slightly tilted, but is still great and flat for the most part. Still, Crash Pads and a Spotter are recommended.
content.location:
Boulder Location: 36.583368, -118.750220

Route Location: The route starts on the right hand side of the Boulder's face, and works up and slightly to the right. Start on the crimps just under the prominent Buda Belly with big foot holds.

content.description:
Wide finger crack on the boulder climbers right of the Butter Muffins boulder. The vertical finger crack terminates at a horizontal hand crack just before the easy top out.

Sit start and stay in the crack with both hands and feet makes this V1 or easy V2. Using face holds brings it down to a still fun V0.
